page.title: 04Jubilee Clock.
page.content: The{Jubilee Clock}was erected in 1887.It commemorates the{Golden {Jubilee}of {Queen Victoria}.The clock was a gift from{Sir Henry Edwards},a local benefactor. The clock is made from cast iron on a Portland Stone base.It has four dials,four busts of Queen Victoria and four town crests. The clock is used by people to set their watches.It is also used as a meeting place.Every two weeks or so a band plays nearby,often the Salvation Army Band. During the months of June,July,August,September and at Christmas,the clock is lit by 176 decorative light bulbs.This makes the clock the prominent landmark of Weymouth Esplanade by day and night. Richard Turner.
